alert.note: Alert for Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 30 at 10:31AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Weld. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1029 AM MDT, Emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. This includes Sand Creek and Lost Creek. Numerous roads are closed in southeast Weld County, and water is flowing over Highway 52 near County Road 73. - This includes the following streams and drainages... East Lost Creek, Comanche Creek, Rock Creek, Jack Rabbit Creek, Mule Creek, Kiowa Creek, Sand Creek, West Sand Creek, and Lost Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area today. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Low lying areas around Roggen and Prospect Valley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
